results.description:
About DECA GamesÂ 

We believe that games should be played for decades but many are abandoned even when a loyal community is screaming to keep them alive. DECA specializes in acquiring games from other developers and reinvigorating them to continue to entertain for decades. When other studios see an old game, we see an amazing set of problems to solve and a huge opportunity.Â 

DECA is a remote company with over 230 people in over 26 countries globally. DECA has been profitable since our inception in 2016. DECA is also a part of the Embracer Group, the largest public gaming company in Europe.

About our culture

We've managed to maintain a small company feel with the stability and resources of a much larger one. We fully believe in the flexibility of a remote workplace. Employees are trusted to manage their time and get things done independently. We believe that egos and politics need to be checked at the virtual door. That means no jerks are allowed, that no job is too small for anyone, and an openness to help and learn from each other is required. We love the challenge of working within constraints and love when we succeed as a team. Check out more about us and our values on our website (www.decagames.com)Â 

About the role

We are looking for a Senior QA Tester with strong experience in GAAS and Live Operations QA fieldÂ  to work with our multi talented team to ensure the delivery of high quality products to our customers. Core hours are 9am to 6pm CET, fully remote, 5 days a week, working weekends when required along with compensation days off during the weekdays

With a keen eye for detail and excellent communication skills, you will ensure that our games, features and systems work as expected and that we deliver bug free content on time. Working together with the rest of the QA team, development department as well as the various stakeholders, you will have the opportunity to understand all the internal dynamics and impact the way we build our product processes.

In this role you will have the opportunity to work with many other disciplines such as design, LiveOps, business intelligence and development engineering, to build and test products that meet the overall business needs. This is a dynamic role with high exposure to many aspects of developing and running a unique Mobile Game.Â If this sounds like you, we would love to meet you and discuss further!

Responsibilities

  • Perform manual functional testing across the company's PC, web and mobile platforms (iOS, Android): Dev Testing, LiveOps Production testing, Development testingÂ  functionality and Manual Testing, smoke tests, Unit Testing , regression as well as any additional ad hoc tests both in development and Production PhaseÂ 
  • Report in real time proactively with stakeholders regarding QA operations with game defects, and Quality concerns from end user perspective including complete steps, identification of root cause, and expected results into communication channels and appropriate bug tracking software along with back to back follow ups until regression phase
  • Complete accountability and responsibility on QA sign offs to production
  • Creating and sending test reports upon completion of test activities and actively involving in planning and solving with stakeholdersÂ 
  • Follow up on issues with the team to ensure that they are fixed and delivered to end users
  • Developing test plans with a strategic selection of test methodologies in advance during the development phaseÂ 
  • Own the quality of the releases to production and make decisions regarding the same
  • Proactively communicate concerns and risks to Product Teams in a professional manner
  • Creation and maintenance of written documentations of knowledge and processes
  • Assist in backlog and defect grooming with the Producers and Cross Department Leads
  • Owning features and ensuring they are tested thoroughly with assurance to Quality of the product to be shipped globally
  • Identifying, escalating and improving QA practices across the project on regular basis accounting to changing product requirements
  • Constantly monitoring community feedback, following up and reporting it to the stakeholders Â 

Requirements

  • 3+ years experience in quality control and assurance of Mobile Video Games
  • Prior experience working with games as a service title and Live Games
  • Experience in Coordinating QA operations with Production Team and other DepartmentsÂ 
  • Good knowledge of Jira and Confluence
  • Experience in a remote working culture is a mustÂ 
  • Experienced in at least one bug tracking software and ability to create detailed and efficient documentation
  • Experience in testing Development ModeÂ  ie use of tools such as IDE, Github, Perforce ,Docker etc
  • Fluent in English and a good communicator, both written and spoken
  • Proven ability to handle stressful situations, prioritize tasks and meet tight deadlines
  • Strong interpersonal skills with high motivation, drive to improve and capacity to learn
  • Able to work independently, adjust to last minute changes and understanding of how to prioritize tasks
  • Fully functional PC/laptop - Windows with Stable Internet connection with minimum 50Mbps

Nice to Have
